page.title: 09White House, Aston Munslow
page.content: The White House was the{Saxon {Manor}of Estune (East Town) in 1042 AD. It was given to the{Stedman {family}by the King 1332 and became their ancestral home until 1947 when its present owner, Miss Purser, bought and restored it to open part of it to the public. It has always been a family house and is still lived in. You can still see parts of the hefty oak cruck timbers. In 1780 a{medieval crosswing}was added. A fire in the same year burned down part of the original Saxon manor and then a{Georgian wing}was added. There is a bake oven which is in the original kitchen which was used in the filming of "Anne Hughes' Diary" by the BBC. Under the original hall lies the Undercroft hewn out of solid rock, a refuge from robbers etc.
